paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Onychalges asaphospathus
Gaud, 1968
: 302
, figs. 3 a, 4 a ( Psoroptidae );
Fain 1988
: 21
( Pyroglyphidae ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Redescription . MALE ( holotype ,
Figs. 10
, 16 A, B, 20 ). Body, including gnathosoma and opisthosomal lobes, 520 ( 510–530 in 6 paratypes ) long and 340 ( 320–340 ) wide.
Idiosoma
. Propodonotal shield about 170 long and 80 wide. Hysteronotal shield about 220 long, 100 wide at level of setae
d 1
and 140 wide at level of setae
f 2
bases. Minimal distance between shields about 50 . Dorsal striae fine. Posterior pair of genital papillae located distinctly outside anterior pair. Aedeagus 15–19 long; sheath of aedeagus present, subequal to aedeagus in length. Diameter of adanal suckers about 19 . Adanal shields fused or narrowly separated anteriorly, about 130 long. Terminal cleft about 20 long. Opisthosomal lobes about 50 wide at base. Apical membrane of opisthosomal lobes absent. Maximum distance between lobes about 55 . Lengths of setae: si 45–50 , se 230–250 ,

FEMALE ( 6 paratypes ,
Figs. 11
, 20 ). Body, including gnathosoma, 440–460 long and 250–260 wide.
Idiosoma
. Propodonotal shield about 150 long and 100 wide. Dorsal striae fine. Epigynum about 90 long. Bursa copulatrix globose. Lengths of setae: si 21–22 , se 245–260 ,

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 10 .
Onychalges asaphospathus Gaud, 1968
, male. A—dorsal view; B—ventral view.

FIGURE 11 .
Onychalges asaphospathus Gaud, 1968
, female. A—dorsal view; B—ventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material examined
. Holotype male ( MRAC 188.234 ),
6 male
,
6 female
and 1 tritonymph paratypes ( MRAC 188.234-188.236 ) from
Clytospiza monteiri (Hartlaub)
( Passeriformes : Estrildidae ),
CAMEROON
: Centre region, Yaounde,
3 ° 52 'N
,
11 ° 31 'E
,
December 1955
, coll. J. Mouchet.

Non-type material examined .
1 male
( MRAC 152.973 ) from
Euschistospiza dybowskii (Oustalet)
( Passeriformes : Estrildidae ),
CAMEROON
: Centre region, Yaounde,
3 ° 52 'N
,
11 ° 31 'E
,
December 1955
, coll. J. Mouchet;
1 male
( 188.238 ) from
Spermestes bicolor (Fraser)
( Passeriformes : Estrildidae ),
CAMEROON
: no other data;
1 female
( MRAC 188.237 ) from same host,
CAMEROON
: no other data.

Hosts and distribution . This species was recorded from
Clytospiza monteiri
( type host) and
Euschistospiza dybowskii
in Cameroon (
Gaud 1968
). Records of one male and female from
Spermestes bicolor
in the same region represent ecological contaminations (
Gaud 1968
).
